greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Longest palindromic factor of (n base 2); in case of tie choose largest; if it begins with 0 complement it.
comment: The "if it begins with 0 complement it" clause is required because nonzero terms in the OEIS may not begin with 0.
link: Lars Blomberg, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999
example: n=12 = 1100, there are two palindromic factors of length 2, namely 11 and 00, and we choose the larger, 11.
n=24 = 11000, longest palindromic factor is 000, complementing gives 111.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 15 2012
